$ul: **followersCount**: number of followers of this actor, as seen by this instance
**followingCount**: number of actors subscribed to by this actor, as seen by this instance
**host**: server on which the actor is resident
**hostRedundancyAllowed**: whether this actor's host allows redundancy of its videos
**name**: immutable name of the actor, used to find or mention it
**description**: text or bio displayed on the account's profile
**displayName**: editable name of the account, displayed in its representations
**userId**: object id for the user tied to this account
**followersCount**: number of followers of this actor, as seen by this instance
**followingCount**: number of actors subscribed to by this actor, as seen by this instance
**host**: server on which the actor is resident
**hostRedundancyAllowed**: whether this actor's host allows redundancy of its videos
**name**: immutable name of the actor, used to find or mention it
**displayName**: editable name of the channel, displayed in its representations
**support**: text shown by default on all videos of this channel, to tell the audience how to support it
**createdAt**: time at which the video object was first drafted
**description**: truncated description of the video, written in Markdown.
**duration**: duration of the video in seconds
**originallyPublishedAt**: used to represent a date of first publication, prior to the practical publication date of `publishedAt`
**publishedAt**: time at which the video was marked as ready for playback (with restrictions depending on `privacy`). Usually set after a `state` evolution.
**updatedAt**: last time the video's metadata was modified
**uuid**: universal identifier for the video, that can be used across instances
**descriptionPath**: path at which to get the full description of maximum `10000` characters
**files**: WebTorrent/raw video files. If WebTorrent is disabled on the server:
**streamingPlaylists**: HLS playlists/manifest files. If HLS is disabled on the server:
**support**: A text tell the audience how to support the video creator
**viewers**: If the video is a live, you have the amount of current viewers
